src:
308 Saham 'Terbakar', IHSG Ditutup Loyo di 6.165
07 Nov 2019, 09:26 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Foto: Ari Saputra

Jakarta - Indeks Harga Saham Gabungan (IHSG) ditutup negatif sore ini. IHSG turun 51 poin (0,8%) ke level 6.165.Nilai tukar dolar Amerika Serikat (AS) terhadap rupiah siang ini berada di level Rp 13.983.Pada pra perdagangan, IHSG naik 17 poin (0,27%) ke 6.234. Indeks LQ45 juga menguat 4 poin (0,41%) ke 992.Membuka perdagangan Kamis (7/11/2019), IHSG menguat 12 poin (0,21%) ke level 6.231. Indeks LQ45 juga naik 2,6 poin (0,27%) poin ke 990.Hingga sesi I berakhir, IHSG berbalik negatif dan turun cukup tajam hingga 82 poin (1,3%) ke level 6.135.Menutup sesi II, IHSG terus turun hingga 51,9 poin (0,8%) ke level 6.165. Perdagangan saham ditransaksikan 606.494 kali dengan nilai Rp 8,3 triliun. Sebanyak 111 saham naik, 308 saham terjungkal dan 144 saham tak berubah.Sementara itu, bursa Amerika Serikat (AS) ditutup Bercampur. Dow Jones ditutup 27.492,56 (-0,00%), NASDAQ ditutup 8.410,63 (-0,29%), S&P 500 ditutup 3.076,77 (+0,07%). Bursa saham AS ditutup melemah tanpa banyak pergerakan.Investor masih cemas terhadap diskusi tentang AS-China yang belum ada realisasi hingga saat ini. AS-China masih belum menentukan lokasi pertemuan dan isi dari perjanjian fase 1 secara konkret.Investor menilai peningkatan saham dalam beberapa waktu lalu tidak akan bertahan lama tanpa adanya progres dari ekonomi yang benar-benar nyata. Bursa Asia dibuka melemah mengikuti pergerakan dari indeks saham AS. Investor masih menanti perkembangan dari AS-China terkait perang dagang. Saat ini belum ada sentimen lainnya yang mendorong indeks Asia.Bursa Asia sore ini mayoritas bergerak di zona hijau, berikut pergerakannya:

Indeks Nikkei 225 naik 26 poin ke 23.330
Indeks Hang Seng menguat 158 poin ke 27.847
Indeks Shanghai bertambah 0,11 poin ke 2.978
Indeks Strait Times naik 17 poin ke 3.280

Saham-saham yang masuk jajaran top gainers antara lain Dian Swastatika (DSSA) naik Rp 975 ke Rp 18.475, Indocement Tunggal (INTP) naik Rp 725 ke Rp 20.725, Asuransi Sinarmas (LIFE) naik Rp 700 ke Rp 5.800, Sinar Mas Multiartha (SMMA) naik Rp 475 ke Rp 10.100.Sementara saham-saham yang masuk jajaran top losers di antaranya Gudang Garam (GGRM) turun Rp 1.575 ke Rp 54.525, Indo Tambangraya (ITMG) turun Rp 725 ke Rp 12.575, Sentral Mitra (LUCK) turun Rp 325 ke Rp 975.Simak Video "Dolar Tembus Rp 14.200 "[Gambas:Video 20detik](eds/ara)
text:
308 Shares 'Burned', JCI Closed Sluggish at 6,165
Nov 7 2019, 09:26 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Photo: Ari Saputra

Jakarta - The Composite Stock Price Index (CSPI) closed negative this afternoon. The Jakarta Composite Index dropped 51 points (0.8%) to 6,165. The exchange rate of the United States dollar (US) against the rupiah this afternoon was at the level of Rp 13,983. In pre-trade, the Jakarta Composite Index rose 17 points (0.27%) to 6,234. The LQ45 index also rose 4 points (0.41%) to 992. Opening trading on Thursday (11/07/2019), the JCI gained 12 points (0.21%) to 6,231. The LQ45 index also rose 2.6 points (0.27%) to 990 points. Until the session I ended, the JCI turned negative and dropped quite sharply to 82 points (1.3%) to the level of 6,135. Closing session II, JCI continued to fall up to 51.9 points (0.8%) to the level of 6,165. Trading in shares was transacted 606,494 times with a value of Rp 8.3 trillion. A total of 111 shares rose, 308 shares tumbled and 144 shares remained unchanged. Meanwhile, the United States (US) exchanges closed mixed. Dow Jones closed 27,492.56 (-0.00%), NASDAQ closed 8,410.63 (-0.29%), S&P 500 closed 3,076.77 (+ 0.07%). US stock markets closed lower without much movement. Investors are still worried about discussions about the US-China which has not been realized until now. The US-China has not yet determined the location of the meeting and the contents of the phase 1 agreement concretely. Investors assess that the increase in shares in the past will not last long without the progress of a real economy. Asian markets opened lower following the movements of the US stock indexes. Investors are still waiting for developments from the US-China related to the trade war. There is currently no other sentiment that has pushed the Asian index. The majority of Asian bourses this afternoon are moving in the green zone, following their movements:

The Nikkei 225 index rose 26 points to 23,330
The Hang Seng Index gained 158 points to 27,847
The Shanghai index added 0.11 points to 2,978
The Strait Times Index rose 17 points to 3,280

Shares that are in the ranks of top gainers include Dian Swastatika (DSSA), up Rp 975 to Rp 18,475, Indocement Tunggal (INTP) up Rp 725 to Rp 20,725, Sinarmas Insurance (LIFE) up Rp 700 to Rp 5,800, Sinar Mas Multiartha ( SMMA) rose Rp 475 to Rp 10,100. While stocks that entered the ranks of top losers included Gudang Garam (GGRM) down Rp 1,575 to Rp 54,525, Indo Tambangraya (ITMG) down Rp 725 to Rp 12,575, Sentral Mitra (LUCK) down Rp 325 to Rp 975. Watch the video "Dollar Breaks Rp 14,200" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (eds / fig)
